alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 8:39AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT APACHE AND NAVAJO COUNTIES THROUGH 915 AM MST... At 838 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Schoens Lake, or 14 miles northwest of Show Low, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Shumway, Schoens Lake, Taylor Airport, White Mountain Lake Estates, Snowflake, and White Mountain Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 between mile markers 328 and 336. State Route 260 between mile markers 328 and 331. State Route 77 between mile markers 348 and 364. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
